title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
sdumitriu - (00:05): 195 tests fixed  
vmassol - (00:08): :)

sdumitriu - (01:23): vmassol: OK, debugged the last failing tests for trunk  
sdumitriu - (01:23): Hopefully we should have a clean build soon  
vmassol - (01:23): very cool  
sdumitriu - (01:23): Then I can start reaing the Hudson mails again  
vmassol - (01:23): yes that'll be good for all of us  
vmassol - (01:24): (to start trusting hudson again)

vmassol - (13:12): sdumitriu: hi, do you have any idea what $auxparams means in create.vm?  
vmassol - (13:13): it's used in   #set($eparent = $util.encodeURI("${parent}${auxparams}")) which I find strange  
sdumitriu - (13:16): vmassol: No idea  
hcross joined #xwiki at 13:18  
lucaa left at 13:38 (Ping timeout: 248 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:40  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 13:52  
vmassol left at 14:40 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 14:40  
vmassol left at 16:09 (Quit: Leaving.  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 16:52  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 17:38  
lucaa - (18:21): hi guys, I think I found an issue with the (new) import...  
lucaa - (18:21): where should I report?  
vmassol - (18:21): jira?  
vmassol - (18:21): (hi anca)  
lucaa - (18:21): here jira http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&&type=1&pid=10352&status=1&status=3&status=4&component=10603&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC ?  
lucaa - (18:22): or where should I look for an existing issue?  
vmassol - (18:22): XAADMINISTRATION  
vmassol - (18:22): since it's packaed in the admin app  
vmassol - (18:22): packaged  
lucaa - (18:22): ok...  
vmassol - (18:23): if it's an important issue the we need to fix it for 2.2 final….  
vmassol - (18:23): which is planned for monday....  
lucaa - (18:23): this "add new version to the existing document" is a new feature of the new import, right? I shouldn't be looking for an existing issue, right?  
vmassol - (18:23): it's not new  
vmassol - (18:23): it was done before RC2  
vmassol - (18:24): so you can create an issue  
lucaa - (18:24): I mean it wasn't in the old import, if there's an issue with it it should be in the list I linked to  
vmassol - (18:24): yes  
lucaa - (18:24): actually the old import issues should still be there  
lucaa - (18:24): ok, reporting  
vmassol - (18:24): some have been closed already  
vmassol - (18:25): are there any left?  
lucaa - (18:25): yes, there are 3  
vmassol - (18:25): I mean the old import  
lucaa - (18:25): I don't know  
lucaa - (18:31): reported: XAADMINISTRATION-110  
vmassol - (18:32): jvelociter: do you think you'll have the time to look at it early monday morning before the release?

dipper joined #xwiki at 20:36  
dipper - (20:37): hey guys  
dipper - (20:37): not sure if someone is here  
dipper - (20:37): just wondering what browsers are supported by xwiki  
sdumitriu - (20:37): All  
dipper - (20:38): that's cool  
sdumitriu - (20:38): Except for the WYSIWYG editor, which doesn't work perfectly yet in Safari, Opera, Chrome  
sdumitriu - (20:38): So basically the WYSIWYG works best in FF and IE  
dipper - (20:38): i'm trying colibri skin in different and looks just dangerously different in Opera  
sdumitriu - (20:38): Really? It shouldn't  
sdumitriu - (20:38): Screenshot?  
dipper - (20:39): i can send pic  
dipper - (20:39): yeah.. any good services for pic?  
sdumitriu - (20:39): tinycoke  
dipper - (20:41): http://tinycoke.com/\_6rLeJvPNK1FHs/xwiki-pic.jpg  
dipper - (20:41): looks like a different color theme is used  
dipper - (20:41): but it's ok in IE6  
sdumitriu - (20:42): What version are you using?  
dipper - (20:42): well.... hmm .. i downloaded not so long ago.. not sure what was the version number... let me check  
sdumitriu - (20:43): 2.1,2, written at the bottom  
dipper - (20:43): xwiki-enterprise-installer-windows-2.1.2.exe  
dipper - (20:43): right  
dipper - (20:43): :)  
sdumitriu - (20:45): Can you force a cache refresh?  
dipper - (20:46): how can I do that? you mean cache refresh in opera?  
dipper - (20:47): anyway what's the point.. i am running on virtual machine and i have installed opera yesterday or the day before  
dipper - (20:48): well, that doesn't seem to be XWiki issue as i was running online version in opera and it was quite good  
dipper - (20:53): sdumitriu: hey you see the space explorer on that screenshot... i am not able to make it work  
dipper - (20:53): it awlays says Loading data...  
dipper - (20:53): i have just installed it  
sdumitriu - (20:53): Where did you get it from?  
dipper - (20:54): hmm xoffice.xwiki.org  
dipper - (20:54): damn no  
dipper - (20:54): let me check  
dipper - (20:54): :)  
dipper - (20:55): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/SpaceExplorerPanelApplication  
sdumitriu - (20:56): No idea what's wrong with it, sorry  
sdumitriu - (20:56): It uses SmartClient, which I don't like  
dipper - (20:56): pity  
dipper - (20:56): what's that  
sdumitriu - (20:57): A JavaScript library  
sdumitriu - (20:57): A huge one  
dipper - (20:57): ah ok  
dipper - (20:57): i read on mailing list that someone has installed it ... no idea what's wrong with mine  
dipper - (20:58): oh may be you know something about xoffice  
sdumitriu - (20:58): Does the Tree view in Document Index work?  
dipper - (20:58): yes  
sdumitriu - (20:58): Hm, then this panel should also work, since it uses the same tree  
dipper - (20:58): the problem is that i want it to be always available  
dipper - (20:59): i was trying to install xoffice add-in, downloaded the installer and it says that .NET required version is not installed  
dipper - (20:59): which version it uses  
sdumitriu - (21:00): Which version of Office do you have?  
dipper - (21:00): 1.0  
dipper - (21:00): ah well  
sdumitriu - (21:00): No, MS Office  
dipper - (21:00): 2008  
dipper - (21:00): 2007  
sdumitriu - (21:00): That should work  
sdumitriu - (21:00): Do you have any .NET runtime installed?  
dipper - (21:00): i have vs2008 installed, so .net3.5 is installed either  
sdumitriu - (21:00): Hm, then it should work  
dipper - (21:01): i check on different machines with vs2008 installed  
sdumitriu - (21:01): Sorry, but I don't know much about XOffice either  
sdumitriu - (21:01): You should check againt tomorrow, when more devs will be online  
dipper - (21:26): sdumitriu: hey  
dipper - (21:26): check this  
dipper - (21:26): http://blogs.msdn.com/vsto/archive/2009/05/07/issues-with-installing-vsto-projects-that-were-published-from-visual-studio-2008-on-windows-7-rc-saurabh-bhatia.aspx  
dipper - (21:27): probably this is the issue  
dipper - (21:30): i guess the only way to solve this is to get the source code and build VSTO locally  
dipper - (21:30): damn...  
dipper - (21:31): i should write to mailing list  
dipper left at 21:37 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
jvelociter left at 21:59 (Quit: jvelociter  
plunden left #xwiki at 22:19  
bblfish left at 22:21 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 23:12  
bblfish - (23:12): hi  
bblfish - (23:12): anyone here?  
sdumitriu - (23:13): Hi  
sdumitriu - (23:13): Me  
bblfish - (23:14): hi  
bblfish - (23:14): I am wondering how to access objects/classes from a component  
bblfish - (23:15): I have looked at the  CalendarPlugin but that is using the old plugin style  
sdumitriu - (23:16): DocumentAccessBridge  
bblfish - (23:17): ah yes  
bblfish - (23:19): btw, can one use java beans in Xwiki, or should one create classes using code such as  
bblfish - (23:19):   BaseClass bclass = doc.getxWikiClass();  
bblfish - (23:19):         bclass.setName("XWiki.CalendarEvent");  
bblfish - (23:19):         needsUpdate |= bclass.addTextField("user", "User", 30);  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 23:19  
sdumitriu - (23:20): latter  
bblfish - (23:21): ok, thanks  
marta left at 23:31 (Quit: Leaving.  
bblfish - (23:41): mhh, it's not clear how I get the class from the DocumentAccessBridge  
bblfish - (23:42): This type of behavior does  not work  
bblfish - (23:42): 2    BaseClass bclass = doc.getxWikiClass();  
bblfish - (23:42):         bclass.setName("XWiki.CalendarEvent");  
bblfish - (23:42):         needsUpdate |= bclass.addTextField("user", "User", 30);  
sdumitriu - (23:42): Hm, indeed  
sdumitriu - (23:43): We're extending the bridge as needed, and so far we didn't need to access the class through the bridge  
sdumitriu - (23:43): from components  
bblfish - (23:45): Is it better to use the old method of plugins?  
sdumitriu - (23:46): Nope  
bblfish - (23:47): ok, I'll check tomorrow on how best to do this then...  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 23:52
